question: The bar has a cross-sectional area A and is subjected to the axial load P. Determine the average normal stresses acting over the shaded section, which is oriented at $\theta$ from the horizontal. <image 1>
description: The image depicts a rectangular bar with a cross-sectional area labeled \( A \). The bar is subjected to an axial load \( P \) applied at both ends, indicated by arrows pointing in opposite directions. Inside the bar, there is a shaded section oriented at an angle \( \theta \) from the horizontal. This shaded section represents the area over which the average normal stresses are to be determined.
